filmography.title: Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: A gentle, confused creature assembled from corpses who is tortured by a world that fears him.
filmography.plot: An obsessed scientist assembles a living being from parts of exhumed corpses.

filmography.title: The Criminal Code
filmography.role_description: A towering, menacing prison inmate who strictly adheres to the 'code' of silence and revenge.
filmography.plot: A district attorney manages to get a man convicted for a crime he didn't commit, only to end up as the warden of the prison where the man is being held.

filmography.title: Scarface
filmography.role_description: A rival gangster to Tony Camonte who meets his end in a bowling alley.
filmography.plot: An ambitious and nearly insane gangster climbs the ladder of success in the mob, but his weakness is his sister.

filmography.title: The Mummy
filmography.role_description: An ancient Egyptian priest resurrected after 3,700 years who seeks to reunite with the reincarnation of his lost love.
filmography.plot: A living mummy stalks the beautiful woman he believes is the reincarnation of his lover.

filmography.title: The Old Dark House
filmography.role_description: A mute, brutish, and scarred butler who becomes dangerous when he gets drunk.
filmography.plot: Stranded travelers stumble upon a strange old house, and find themselves at the mercy of a highly eccentric and potentially dangerous family.

filmography.title: The Ghoul
filmography.role_description: An Egyptologist who returns from the dead to punish those who stole a sacred jewel from his tomb.
filmography.plot: An Egyptologist returns from the dead to take revenge on those who have violated his tomb.

filmography.title: The Lost Patrol
filmography.role_description: A religious fanatic soldier who loses his mind in the desert heat while under siege.
filmography.plot: A British patrol is stranded in the Mesopotamian desert during World War I and is picked off one by one by unseen snipers.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The House of Rothschild
filmography.role_description: A menacing, anti-Semitic Prussian ambassador who opposes the rise of the Rothschild banking family.
filmography.plot: The history of the Rothschild banking family, focusing on their rise to power and their struggle against anti-Semitism.

filmography.title: The Black Cat
filmography.role_description: A satan-worshipping architect who keeps the preserved bodies of women in glass cases in his modernist home.
filmography.plot: American honeymooners in Hungary are trapped in the home of a Satan-worshipping priest when the bride is taken there for medical help.

filmography.title: Bride of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: The monster returns, now learning to speak and seeking a mate, delivering a performance of tragic depth.
filmography.plot: Mary Shelley reveals the main characters of her novel survived: Dr. Frankenstein, goaded by an even madder scientist, builds his monster a mate.

filmography.title: The Black Room
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing twin brothers, one kind and one evil, fulfilling an ancient family prophecy.
filmography.plot: A prophecy dictates that the younger of two twin brothers will kill the older in the 'Black Room' of their castle.

filmography.title: The Raven
filmography.role_description: A fugitive murderer on the run who is disfigured by a mad surgeon and forced to do his bidding.
filmography.plot: A brilliant surgeon obsessed with Edgar Allan Poe saves the life of a beautiful dancer and goes mad when he can't have her.

filmography.title: The Walking Dead
filmography.role_description: A man wrongly executed for murder who is brought back to life by science, seeking justice against the mobsters who framed him.
filmography.plot: A man wrongly executed is restored to life by a scientist and seeks revenge on the mobsters who framed him.

filmography.title: The Man Who Changed His Mind
filmography.role_description: A brilliant scientist who discovers a way to transfer minds between bodies and uses it for selfish ends.
filmography.plot: A mad scientist swaps the mind of a crippled tycoon with that of a healthy young man to win the love of a woman.

filmography.title: Son of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: Karloff's final feature film performance as the Monster, who is revived by the son of his original creator.
filmography.plot: One of Frankenstein's sons finds his father's monster in a coma and revives him, only to find out he is controlled by Ygor.

filmography.title: Tower of London
filmography.role_description: The club-footed, bald executioner and henchman to Richard III, carrying out his bloody orders.
filmography.plot: In 15th-century England, Richard, Duke of Gloucester, schemes to gain the throne with the help of his executioner.

filmography.title: The Body Snatcher
filmography.role_description: A sinister grave robber in 19th-century Edinburgh who blackmails a doctor he supplies with cadavers.
filmography.plot: A ruthless doctor and his young prize student find themselves continually harassed by their murderous supplier of illegal cadavers.

filmography.title: Isle of the Dead
filmography.role_description: A rigid Greek general on a quarantined island who becomes convinced that a vampire is responsible for the plague-like deaths.
filmography.plot: On a Greek island during the 1912 war, several people are trapped by a quarantine for the plague... or something more sinister.

filmography.title: Bedlam
filmography.role_description: The cruel and corrupt head of the notorious St. Mary's of Bethlehem asylum in 18th-century London.
filmography.plot: In 1761 London, the sadistic master of the Bedlam insane asylum commits a sane woman who tries to expose his conditions.

filmography.title: Lured
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, possibly mad fashion designer who becomes a suspect in the hunt for a serial killer.
filmography.plot: A taxi dancer in London disappears, and her friend goes undercover for Scotland Yard to find a serial killer targeting young women.

filmography.title: Corridors of Blood
filmography.role_description: A 19th-century surgeon dedicated to creating anesthetic gas who becomes addicted to his own discovery.
filmography.plot: A surgeon in 1840s London experiments with anesthetic gases to make surgery painless but becomes addicted and falls in with criminals.

filmography.title: The Raven
filmography.role_description: An evil wizard who engages in a magical duel with rival sorcerers in this horror-comedy.
filmography.plot: A magician who has been turned into a raven turns to a former sorcerer for help in this comedic adaptation of Poe's poem.

filmography.title: The Comedy of Terrors
filmography.role_description: The senile, deaf father-in-law of an unscrupulous undertaker in this ensemble horror comedy.
filmography.plot: An undertaker who hasn't had any customers lately decides to go out and create some by killing people.

filmography.title: Black Sabbath
filmography.role_description: A vampire father who returns home to feed on his family in the 'Wurdulak' segment of this horror anthology.
filmography.plot: A trio of atmospheric horror tales about a stalked woman, a vampire-like beast, and a nurse haunted by a ring.

filmography.title: Die, Monster, Die!
filmography.role_description: A reclusive scientist whose experiments with a radioactive meteorite have mutated his family and estate.
filmography.plot: A young man visits his fiancée's estate to find that her wheelchair-bound father has discovered a meteorite that mutates living things.

filmography.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas!
filmography.role_description: The voice of the iconic Christmas-hating character and the narrator of the beloved animated special.
filmography.plot: A grumpy hermit hatches a plan to steal Christmas from the Whos of Whoville.
filmography.awards: Grammy Award: Win – Best Recording for Children

filmography.title: The Sorcerers
filmography.role_description: An elderly hypnotist who invents a mind-control device to experience the sensations of youth through a younger subject.
filmography.plot: An elderly couple invent a mind control device and use it to control a young man to experience new thrills, but things go too far.

filmography.title: Targets
filmography.role_description: An aging horror film star who wants to retire, feeling his brand of gothic horror is outdated compared to real-world violence.
filmography.plot: An aging horror star's retirement announcement coincides with a young man's shooting spree in Los Angeles.
